paragraphs.title: STEP I: Register the dataset using below SQLServer access options
paragraphs.text:
%snappydata
{
val datasetName = z.input("Enter Name for the Dataset:", "AirlineRef").asInstanceOf[String]
val url = z.input("Enter JDBC URL for SQLServer:", "jdbc:mysql://localhost/").asInstanceOf[String]
val database = z.input("Enter Database Name:", "my-database").asInstanceOf[String]
val SqlServerTable = z.input("Enter Table Name:", "AirlineDataWithRowID").asInstanceOf[String]
val user = z.input("Enter User:", "my-user").asInstanceOf[String]
val password = z.input("Enter Password:", "my-password").asInstanceOf[String]

z.put("SqlServerTable", SqlServerTable)
z.put("datasetName", datasetName)
z.put("user" ,user)
z.put("password",password)
z.put("database",database)
z.put("url",url)

var connectionString =s"create external table $datasetName using JDBC options (url '$url',databaseName '$database' , dbtable '$SqlServerTable', user '$user', password '$password', driver 'com.microsoft.sqlserver.jdbc.SQLServerDriver'"
z.put("connectionString",connectionString)
}

paragraphs.title: STEP IV: Cache the data in SnappyData Column/Row table
paragraphs.text:
%snappydata
{
import org.apache.spark.sql.SnappySession

val ss = new SnappySession(snc.sparkContext)

val datasetName = z.get("datasetName")
val tabName = datasetName+ "_cache"

val tableType = z.select("SnappyData Table type", Seq(("column" ,"Column"),
                                                    ("row","row"))).asInstanceOf[String]
ss.sql(s"drop table if exists $tabName")
ss.sql(s"create table $tabName using $tableType as select * from $datasetName" )

println(s"Created table named $tabName")
println("With row count = " + ss.table(s"$tabName").count )
}
